channel.title: BIRM-CAM on BIRMCAM
channel.description: Recent content in BIRM-CAM on BIRMCAM

item.title: About
item.description: BIRMCAM is led by Professors Tom Marshall (University of Birmingham) and Sylvia Richardson (MRC Biostatistics Unit, University of Cambridge). You can read more about the project here and find out about the other MRC-NIHR funded projects here. Our Team University of Birmingham Dr Krishnarajah Nirantharakumar Professor Christopher Yau (now University of Manchester) Dr Francesca Crowe Dr Linda Nichols Dr Tom Taverner Dr Magdalena Teresa Skrybant University of Cambridge

item.title: About The Project
item.description: Introduction BIRMCAM is led by Professors Tom Marshall (University of Birmingham) and Sylvia Richardson (MRC Biostatistics Unit, University of Cambridge). Multimorbidity Multimorbidity is when people suffer from more than one long-term illness. It is increasingly common as people live longer. It is important because individual illnesses have knock-on effects on others, it is more complex managing multiple than single illnesses, and multimorbid patients are heavy users of medications and health services.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
